Class C2SMain

  • java.lang.Object

extends java.lang.Object
    Main class for starting the application. View README.md for additional guidance.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        <-schema|-translate|-s|-t> <propertiesFile> <databaseName> <-dp|-dn|-r> View README for additional guidance.
        Parameters:
        args - Arguments for the application.

      • getLabelMapping

        static void getLabelMapping()
        This method performs two important tasks for the translator tool: - Firstly, the translator tool checks to see if it can optimise any of the queries by storing a mapping between unique keys, and the label of the node that tke key will only appear under. These mappings are stored in the labelProps object.

        - Secondly, it reads in all the possible types of relationships (used for example when deleting nodes from the relational schema).

      • warmUpResetSSL

        static void warmUpResetSSL()
        warm up the Neo4j caches if the server has just been turned on. https://neo4j.com/developer/kb/warm-the-cache-to-improve-performance-from-cold-start/ also, if there is an SSL issue when changing databases, attempt to fix it by running some fix up code.

      • printError

        private static void printError(int errorCode)
        If there is an error in the main method of C2SMain.java, then one of these messages will be printed out to the terminal.
        Parameters:
        errorCode - Error code matching the error that has occurred.

      • convertGraphSchema

        private static void convertGraphSchema(java.lang.String neo4jSchema,
                                       java.lang.String databaseName)
        Converting a 'dump' from an existing Neo4j graph into a relational schema, before executing on a relational backend.
        Parameters:
        neo4jSchema - The 'dump' file being converted. This location is set in the properties file, under the key 'neo4jSchema'.
        databaseName - The name of the database to be used for storing the relational representation.

      • runDirectPG

        private static void runDirectPG(java.lang.String sql,
                                java.lang.String dbName)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Executes the query sql on the relational database named dbName. The arguments are themselves passed as arguments currently to a Windows batch file, which performs the query on the Postgres database. The results are then piped back into this tool and outputted.
        Parameters:
        sql - Query to be executed on the database.
        dbName - Name of the relational database for the query to be executed on.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Some issue with the Buffered Reader object.

      • translateCypherToSQL

        static void translateCypherToSQL(java.lang.String cypherInput,
                                 java.io.File f_cypher,
                                 java.io.File f_pg,
                                 java.lang.String dbName,
                                 boolean execNeo4j)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Method for translating Cypher to SQL.
        Parameters:
        cypherInput - The original Cypher input that is to be translated.
        f_cypher - The file object for storing the results from Neo4j (if desired).
        f_pg - The file object for storing the results from Postgres (if desired).
        dbName - The name of the database to execute the newly created SQL on.
        execNeo4j - In the case that the user is just running the tool in its normal operation, there is no need to deal with any of the files, or printing of the results to these files. Instead, the newly generated SQL is executed via a .bat script on Postgres, with the results piped back to this tool.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Something didn't go to plan...

      • executeSQL

        private static boolean executeSQL(java.lang.String sql,
                                  java.io.File pg_results,
                                  boolean printOutput,
                                  java.lang.String dbName)
        Execute the SQL command on the database. If query is a concatenation of multiple queries, then perform then one by one in order that was passed to the method. Type of method call depends on whether or not query begins with CREATE or not.
        Parameters:
        sql - SQL to execute.
        pg_results - File to store the results.
        printOutput - Write the results to a file for viewing.
        dbName - Name of the database the SQL will be executed on.
        Returns:
        True if the execution on Postgres was successful, false otherwise.

      • printSummary

        private static void printSummary(java.lang.String line,
                                 java.lang.String sql,
                                 java.io.File f_cypher,
                                 java.io.File f_pg)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Print summary of the translation.
        Parameters:
        line - Cypher query.
        sql - SQL equivalent.
        f_cypher - File containing Neo4J output.
        f_pg - File containing Postgres output.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Error comparing the files f_cypher and f_pg.

      • translationFail

        private static void translationFail(java.lang.String line,
                                    java.lang.String sql,
                                    java.io.File f_cypher,
                                    java.io.File f_pg)
                             throws java.io.IOException
        If the translation failed, alert the user.
        Parameters:
        line - Original Cypher input.
        sql - Converted SQL.
        f_cypher - Neo4j results file object.
        f_pg - Postgres results file object.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Something went wrong in printSummary()
